FuncDef: The display srv6-te policy last-down-reason command displays records about events where SRv6 TE Policies or segment lists in SRv6 TE Policies go down.You can query a maximum of 50000 Segment List down records and a maximum of 256 segment list down records under each SRv6 TE Policy.
CLIs: display srv6-te policy last-down-reason [ endpoint <endpoint-ip> color <color-value> | policy-name <name-value> | binding-sid <binding-sid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the endpoint of an SRv6 TE Policy.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the color value of an SRv6 TE Policy.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of an SRv6 TE Policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies a binding SID.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display srv6-te policy last-down-reason policy-name p1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check records about events where SRv6 TE Policies or segment lists in SRv6 TE Policies go down, run the display srv6-te policy last-down-reason command. The command output facilitates troubleshooting.
